project_metadata.project_name: Supply, Testing and Delivery of (15) Custom Made Dataloggerfor Panay River Basin
project_metadata.client_name: Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA)

electrical_tests.expected: Device power off when switching via SW2

electrical_tests.measured: Typical at 32.8V. Recommendation: Expected to run at voltage lower than the typical.

electrical_tests.expected: Device shutdown if total current reaches 6.12A (at 5.1% tolerance) or if total power reaches ~100W, whichever comes first
electrical_tests.measured: Fault indicator triggered (see E-04), followed by system shutdown.

electrical_tests.expected: Auto-retry, the system will check consecutively if fault is removed
electrical_tests.measured: Systems perform bistable reset if fault is still present, otherwise will resume normal operation when fault is removed.

electrical_tests.expected: LED will light if undervoltage lockout (See E-02) is detected or during power fail detection (See E-03)
electrical_tests.measured: Lights up in accordance to the expected voltage values

electrical_tests.expected: LED will light if input voltage reaches ~11.89V
electrical_tests.measured: Lights up in accordance to the expected voltage values
Recommendation: The device should only be powered using the DC barrel jack or Terminal Block at MCB

electrical_tests.expected: Minimum of -40°C to a Maximum of +150 °C
electrical_tests.measured: Reaches a constant of <=110 °C at 5A, with a line regulation from 12V input supply. Recommendation: Do not remove passive heatsink from the back for proper operation.

electrical_tests.parameter: [Power] +3.3V Rails: LDO's for Modem and MCU Peripherals
electrical_tests.expected: Dropout voltage of <=400mV, from constant output current of >=2A
electrical_tests.measured: Significantly lower than the maximum droupout voltage.

functional_tests.observation: SWD lines are properly connected and can upload to the Hardware Accelerator (HA) SoM.

functional_tests.feature: [PTSA: Flash] Enabling access port protection mechanism
functional_tests.observation: Security protection applied, and when the intention to retrieve the flash is performed the pages are erased.

functional_tests.feature: [PTSA: Flash] Signing keys for Device Firmware Upgrade (DFU)
functional_tests.observation: Digital signing keys are respected, therefore unsigned application are not considered valid.
Long press to start the DFU process.

All commands are tested and working. List of the following available commands: sim_pwr, sys_info, power_ctrl, sys_reboot, buzzer (with subcommands control and toggle), sdi, retval, history, help, and stats.
Analog-Front-End design for SDI-12 is working properly. It has been tested with several SDI-12 enabled devices such as SenseCAP CO2 (SKU 101991028) and the actual provided OTT-RLS for water level
Indenpendent control to EFuse, Buck-Converter, and modem power tree.
When MCU is removed, the system should not power up.
Ability to perform SDI-12 commands to Hardware Accelerator (see F-06) via UART1
A custom binary has been built to accommodate Bluetooth SPP in expense to removal of OTA, confirmed the binary update by performing AT+GMR
Ability to perform AT commands to on-board WiFi and BLE-capable modem via UART2
5V-tolerant protocol via UART6. Recommendation: Due to some variances in UART AFE on the market, it is highly advisable to add a 100 ohms terminating resistor closer to the terminal block.
Ability to perform AT commands to PTSA's cellular modem via UART6
CANH and CANL are observe to properly performed recessive and dominant logic, while the test shows only using the UART. The CAN software layer are performed at MCU-level
Ability to perform UART protocol on a RS232 logic levels via UART8

Ability to perform UART protocol on a RS485 logic levels via UART4, only supports half-duplex communication without the expense of additional direction pin. Recommendation: During testing, the inverting lines must be terminated with another RS485-capable device
Ability to perform UART protocol on a RS232 logic levels via UART5
Intelligently identify and remove debounced on the lines.
On-board reset button attached to the debounced inputs (see F-18)
